 '<h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Sacha</strong><p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-661" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Sacha_310_height.png" alt="logo_sacha_v1_trans" width="196" height="100" />SACHA (Segmentation Automatisée Compétitive de l’Hippocampe et de l’Amygdale) is a software dedicated to the joint segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala from 3D-T1 MRI brain scans ([1]
 [2]) with prior knowledge on the location of the hippocampus and the amygdala derived from a probabilistic atlas and relative positions with respect to automatically identified anatomical landmarks. This method has been validated by comparison with manual tracing in healthy controls
 patients with Alzheimer’s disease and patients with epilepsy ([1]
 [2]). It has also been successfully applied to over 5,000 MRI scans in patients with various conditions ([3]
 [4]
 [5]
 [6]).</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: marie.chupin@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">References: <ol> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/files/marie_neuroimage2009.pdf" >Chupin M et al. Automatic segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala driven by hybrid constraints: method and validation. <strong>Neuroimage</strong> 46:749-761
 2009</a>. 	Chupin M et al. Anatomically constrained region deformation for the automated segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala: Method and validation on controls and patients with Alzheimer\'s disease. <strong>Neuroimage</strong> 34:996-1019
 2007. 	Chupin M et al. Fully automatic hippocampus segmentation and classification in Alzheimer\'s disease and mild cognitive impairment applied on data from ADNI. <strong>Hippocampus</strong> 19:579-587
 2009. 	Colliot O et al. Discrimination between Alzheimer disease
 mild cognitive impairment
 and normal aging by using automated segmentation of the hippocampus. <strong>Radiology</strong> 248:194-201
 2008. </ol> &nbsp; <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Whasa</strong><p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-667" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Whasa_196_145.png" alt="WHASA" width="196" height="145" />WHASA (White matter Hyperintensities Automated Segmentation Algorithm) is an algorithm for the automated segmentation of White Matter Hyperintensities (WMH). This approach segments hyperintensities from T2-FLAIR and 3D T1 MRI brain scans. The method has been validated by comparison with manual tracings in 67 patients acquired on 6 different 1.5T MRI scanners with various sequences as used in clinical routine (slice thickness on FLAIR images about 5mm). It has also been applied to over 1000 patients from various centres with both 1.5 and 3T MRI scanners.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: marie.chupin@upmc.fr and ludovic.fillon@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/files/thomas_PLoS_One_published.pdf" >T. Samaille
 L. Fillon et al. Contrast-Based Fully Automatic Segmentation of White Matter Hyperintensities: Method and Validation. <strong>PLoS ONE. </strong>7(11): e48953
 2012.</a>;  <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Brain network toolbox</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">"https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download" ><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-691" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Logo_alto_100.png" alt="Logo_alto_100" width="196" height="100" /></a> A list of MATLAB routines for characterizing brain network topology though graph theoretical indices can be found at the website of the FreeBorN consortium
 which promotes the interaction and visibility of the research teams studying brain connectivity and network theory.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com and mario.chavez@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download" >https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download</a>;  <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Deformetrica</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">"http://www.deformetrica.org/" ><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-638" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Deformetrica_logo_usato.png" alt="Deformetrica_logo_alto" width="196" height="100" />Deformetrica</a> is a software for the statistical analysis of 2D and 3D shape data. It essentially computes deformations of the 2D or 3D ambient space
 which
 in turn
 warp any object embedded in this space
 whether this object is a curve
 a surface
 a structured or unstructured set of points
 or any combination of them.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1053811914005205" >S. Durrleman et al. Morphometry of anatomical shape complexes with dense deformations and sparse parameters. <strong>NeuroImage. </strong>101(1): 35-49
 2014.</a>'

 '<h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Sacha</strong><p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-661" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Sacha_310_height.png" alt="logo_sacha_v1_trans" width="196" height="100" />SACHA (Segmentation Automatisée Compétitive de l’Hippocampe et de l’Amygdale) is a software dedicated to the joint segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala from 3D-T1 MRI brain scans ([1]
 [2]) with prior knowledge on the location of the hippocampus and the amygdala derived from a probabilistic atlas and relative positions with respect to automatically identified anatomical landmarks. This method has been validated by comparison with manual tracing in healthy controls
 patients with Alzheimer’s disease and patients with epilepsy ([1]
 [2]). It has also been successfully applied to over 5,000 MRI scans in patients with various conditions ([3]
 [4]).</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: marie.chupin@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">References: <ol> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/files/marie_neuroimage2009.pdf" >Chupin M et al. Automatic segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala driven by hybrid constraints: method and validation. <strong>Neuroimage</strong> 46:749-761
 2009</a>. 	Chupin M et al. Anatomically constrained region deformation for the automated segmentation of the hippocampus and the amygdala: Method and validation on controls and patients with Alzheimer\'s disease. <strong>Neuroimage</strong> 34:996-1019
 2007. 	Chupin M et al. Fully automatic hippocampus segmentation and classification in Alzheimer\'s disease and mild cognitive impairment applied on data from ADNI. <strong>Hippocampus</strong> 19:579-587
 2009. 	Colliot O et al. Discrimination between Alzheimer disease
 mild cognitive impairment
 and normal aging by using automated segmentation of the hippocampus. <strong>Radiology</strong> 248:194-201
 2008. </ol> &nbsp; <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Whasa</strong><p style="text-align: justify;"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-667" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Whasa_196_145.png" alt="WHASA" width="196" height="145" />WHASA (White matter Hyperintensities Automated Segmentation Algorithm) is an algorithm for the automated segmentation of White Matter Hyperintensities (WMH). This approach segments hyperintensities from T2-FLAIR and 3D T1 MRI brain scans. The method has been validated by comparison with manual tracings in 67 patients acquired on 6 different 1.5T MRI scanners with various sequences as used in clinical routine (slice thickness on FLAIR images about 5mm). It has also been applied to over 1000 patients from various centres with both 1.5 and 3T MRI scanners.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: marie.chupin@upmc.fr and ludovic.fillon@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/files/thomas_PLoS_One_published.pdf" >T. Samaille
 L. Fillon et al. Contrast-Based Fully Automatic Segmentation of White Matter Hyperintensities: Method and Validation. <strong>PLoS ONE. </strong>7(11): e48953
 2012.</a>;  <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Brain network toolbox</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">"https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download" ><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-691" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Logo_alto_100.png" alt="Logo_alto_100" width="196" height="100" /></a> A list of MATLAB routines for characterizing brain network topology though graph theoretical indices can be found at the website of the FreeBorN consortium
 which promotes the interaction and visibility of the research teams studying brain connectivity and network theory.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com and mario.chavez@upmc.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download" >https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/download</a>;  <h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Deformetrica</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">"http://www.deformetrica.org/" ><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-638" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Deformetrica_logo_usato.png" alt="Deformetrica_logo_alto" width="196" height="100" />Deformetrica</a> is a software for the statistical analysis of 2D and 3D shape data. It essentially computes deformations of the 2D or 3D ambient space
 which
 in turn
 warp any object embedded in this space
 whether this object is a curve
 a surface
 a structured or unstructured set of points
 or any combination of them.</p> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contacts: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Reference: "http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1053811914005205" >S. Durrleman et al. Morphometry of anatomical shape complexes with dense deformations and sparse parameters. <strong>NeuroImage. </strong>101(1): 35-49
 2014.</a>'

 ' TV Report - French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6)</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 27th September 2015\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : ICM
 Brain and Spine Institute
 Paris\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Authors: Mario Chavez
 Fabrizio De Vico Fallani
 Fanny Grosselin
 Laurent Hugueville
 Xavier Navarro\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: Report realized by the team of Wendy Bouchard of the French TV newsmagazine ""http://www.m6.fr/emission-zone_interdite/" >Zone Interdite</a>" broadcast on M6 once every two weeks on Sunday prime time. This report has been performed at the "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a> of the Brain and Spine Institute (<a dir="ltr" title="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/" href="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/"  rel="nofollow">ICM</a>) in Paris. It was about the research conducted by the Aramis team on the Brain-computer interface. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier. Very well done!\nL\n\n&nbsp;\n Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste!\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti
 S. Allassonnière
 O. Colliot and S. Durrleman - "https://hal-polytechnique.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01163213/document" > A Mixed­ Effect Model with Time Reparametrization for Longitudinal Univariate Manifold-valued Data</em></a>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Oral : P. Gori
 O. Colliot
 L. Marrakchi-Kacem
 Y. Worbe
 S. Lecomte
 C. Poupon
 A. Hartmann
 N. Ayache and S. Durrleman -  "https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01142628/document" >Joint Morphometry of Fiber Tracts and Gray Matter structures using Double Diffeomorphisms</a></em>\n\n&nbsp;\n Conference OHBM 2015 - Organization for Human Brain Mapping</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : June 14th - 18th 2015\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Honolulu
 Hawaii
 USA\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: It is the primary international organization dedicated to using neuroimaging to discover the organization of the human brain. "http://www.humanbrainmapping.org/" >link</a>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab has massively participated with 14 posters and a seminary talk of our team leader Olivier during the full-day course “Pattern Recognition for NeuroImaging”. "https://www.aramislab.fr/ohbm-2015/" >More...</a>\n\n&nbsp;\n Research Highlights - IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Authors: Fabrizio De Vico Fallani et al.\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Title: Hierarchy of Neural Organization in the Embryonic Spinal Cord: Granger-Causality Graph Analysis of In Vivo Calcium Imaging Data\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Journal: IEEE Transaction Neural Systems and Rehabilitation Engineering
 23
 2015\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Link: "http://tnsre.embs.org/2015/05/06/hierarchy-of-neural-organization-in-the-embryonic-spinal-cord-granger-causality-graph-analysis-of-in-vivo-calcium-imaging-data/" >Paper</a>\n\n&nbsp;\n Seminar - Denis Le Bihan - May 18th 2015</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : May 18th
 2015 at 11:00am\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Speaker : Denis Le Bihan (Neurospin
 CEA)\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Title: Diffusion MRI: What water tells us about the brain\n\n&nbsp;\n Seminar - Ron Kikinis - May 11th 2015</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : May 11th
 2015 at 11:00am\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Speaker : Ron Kikinis (Harvard Medical School)\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Title: Medical Image Computing\n\n&nbsp;\n Seminar - Daniel Rueckert - March 23rd 2015</h2>\n<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : March 23rd

 '2014-11-18 15:18:57'
 '2014-11-18 14:18:57'
 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs</h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 24 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: October 2014 (starting date can be modulated)   Master Internships /  Stages de Master</em><ul> 	"files/job_offers/stage_classification.pdf" >Automatic classification of patients with Alzheimer\'s disease from Magnetic Resonance Imaging data</a>  - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	"files/job_offers/sujet_stage_DBS.pdf" >Construction et personnalisation de modèles anatomiques numériques de patients parkinsoniens traités par stimulation cérébrale profonde</a>   - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible   Other positions &nbsp;'

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs</h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span 	"https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/wall" >Human Connectomics</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 18 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	"https://f56c6bf4-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/fr2eborn/wall/postdocopenposition/ARAMIS-MYCENAE_postdoc_offer_1.pdf?attachauth=ANoY7coaUgHIKC23VR8Us46280QHyGdSNCInisO8ZunncsTKiCkgmJaCvtBs21zadO8zxrfMVsChks0kiuWidyXuZbi467YmIMzbHMirwO9tWC-_j2QRQKxQc-pWbKEgpEi2464YZLf1hyck5AleNJ-7mP9acuHRqCTksCDfrQvM-HZ2f4uryDCTMaY2hgTEAReW23qP1rmfFiHi5yrsFxjf54ZmTkGrrjxvKjmGM5dxUqAdSCjgLaLYsKf6pQGJCR2OTMFdywsmYN0xyZrXUPJIzynEZMkXFg%3D%3D&amp;attredirects=0"  ' Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College

 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: Aramis team participated with two works chosen respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti
 S. Allassonnière

Durrleman -  Joint Morphometry of Fiber Tracts and Gray Matter structures using Double Diffeomorphisms</em>  Conference OHBM 2015 - The <strong>Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM)</strong> is the primary international organization dedicated to using neuroimaging to discover the organization of the human brain.Date : June 14th - 18th 2015 Location : Honolulu

"http://www.humanbrainmapping.org/" >link</a> Posters :  </em>  Research Highlights - IEEE Engineering in Medicine and BiologyAuthors: Fabrizio De Vico Fallani et al.  ' Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation.  '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs</h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 24 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	"https://sites.google.com/site/fr2eborn/wall" >Human Connectomics</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 18 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	"https://f56c6bf4-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/fr2eborn/wall/postdocopenposition/ARAMIS-MYCENAE_postdoc_offer_1.pdf?attachauth=ANoY7coaUgHIKC23VR8Us46280QHyGdSNCInisO8ZunncsTKiCkgmJaCvtBs21zadO8zxrfMVsChks0kiuWidyXuZbi467YmIMzbHMirwO9tWC-_j2QRQKxQc-pWbKEgpEi2464YZLf1hyck5AleNJ-7mP9acuHRqCTksCDfrQvM-HZ2f4uryDCTMaY2hgTEAReW23qP1rmfFiHi5yrsFxjf54ZmTkGrrjxvKjmGM5dxUqAdSCjgLaLYsKf6pQGJCR2OTMFdywsmYN0xyZrXUPJIzynEZMkXFg%3D%3D&amp;attredirects=0" >Modeling and analysis of neuronal activity and connectivity from in-vivo calcium imaging</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 12 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: patients with Alzheimer\'s disease from Magnetic Resonance Imaging data </a>- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/sujet_stage_DBS.pdf" >Construction et personnalisation de modèles anatomiques numériques de patients parkinsoniens traités par stimulation cérébrale  2013 at 11am <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Speaker : John Ashburner (University College London) <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Title: <span style="color: #222222;">Growth and Atrophy Modelling With Diffeomorphisms;'

 '2015-10-09 08:49:54'
 '2015-10-09 07:49:54'
 ' TV Report - French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6)<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 27th September 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : ICM
 Brain and Spine Institute
 Paris <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Authors: Mario Chavez
 Fabrizio De Vico Fallani
 Fanny Grosselin
 Laurent Hugueville
 Xavier Navarro <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: Report realized by the team of Wendy Bouchard of the French TV newsmagazine ""http://www.m6.fr/emission-zone_interdite/" >Zone Interdite</a>" broadcast on M6 once every two weeks on Sunday prime time. This report has been performed at the "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a> of the Brain and Spine Institute (<a dir="ltr" title="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/" href="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/"  rel="nofollow">ICM</a>) in Paris and inspired by the research conducted by the Inria ARAMIS team. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Link: "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BmGiaPG9cnA" >Video on YouTube</a>;  Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti
 S. Allassonnière
 O. Colliot and S. Durrleman - "https://hal-polytechnique.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01163213/document" > A Mixed­ Effect Model with Time Reparametrization for Longitudinal Univariate Manifold-valued Data</em></a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Oral : P. Gori
 O. Colliot
 L. Marrakchi-Kacem
 Y. Worbe
 S. Lecomte
 C. Poupon
 A. Hartmann
 N. Ayache and S. Durrleman -  "https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01142628/document" >Joint Morphometry of Fiber Tracts and Gray Matter structures using Double Diffeomorphisms</a></em>;  Conference OHBM 2015 - Organization for Human Brain Mapping<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : June 14th - 18th 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Honolulu
 Hawaii

 ' TV Report - French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6)<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 27th September 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : ICM
 Brain and Spine Institute
 Paris <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Authors: Mario Chavez
 Fabrizio De Vico Fallani
 Fanny Grosselin
 Laurent Hugueville
 Xavier Navarro <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: Report realized by the team of Wendy Bouchard of the French TV newsmagazine ""http://www.m6.fr/emission-zone_interdite/" >Zone Interdite</a>" broadcast on M6 once every two weeks on Sunday prime time. This report has been performed at the "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a> of the Brain and Spine Institute (<a dir="ltr" title="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/" href="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/"  rel="nofollow">ICM</a>) in Paris. It was about the research conducted by the Aramis team on the Brain-computer interface. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier.  ' TV Report - French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6)<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 27th September 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : ICM
 Brain and Spine Institute
 Paris <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Authors: Mario Chavez
 Fabrizio De Vico Fallani
 Fanny Grosselin
 Laurent Hugueville
 Xavier Navarro <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: Report realized by the team of Wendy Bouchard of the French TV newsmagazine ""http://www.m6.fr/emission-zone_interdite/" >Zone Interdite</a>" broadcast on M6 once every two weeks on Sunday prime time. This report has been performed at the "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a> of the Brain and Spine Institute (<a dir="ltr" title="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/" href="http://icm-institute.org/en/mission-en/"  rel="nofollow">ICM</a>) in Paris. It was about the research conducted by the Aramis team on the Brain-computer interface. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier. Well done! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Link: "https://www.facebook.com/zoneinterditem6/videos/vb.112189452160359/955692764476686/?type=2&amp;theater" >Video</a>;  Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4"  permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...).\n<h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists\n</h1>\n<ul>\n 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  anytime - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr\n 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/postdoc_HIPLAY7.pdf">Medical image computing for high-resolution 7 Tesla MRI</a> - Duration: from 2 to 3 years - Starting date:  as soon as possible - Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr\n 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Post-doc-2017_IPL_Neuromarkers_For_diffusion-2.pdf">Knowledge models for analysis and interpretation of genetic data</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 18 months - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  November 2017 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr\n 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Research_position_NETBCI.pdf"  Dynamic brain networks in brain-computer interface learning</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: 1 April 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com</del>\n\n<h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis\n</h1>\n<ul>\n 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis

 (808
 3
 '2015-10-23 14:24:33'
 '2015-10-23 13:24:33'
 ' Oct 23: New PhD position opened!We are looking for highly motivated students with a strong background in statistical learning and data analysis. The PhD will be about the development of novel learning methods for the statistical exploitation of multimodal longitudinal data sets. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Sept 27: ARAMIS in the news!Aramis was broadcasted yesterday in the French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6) on Sunday prime time. The report was about the brain-computer interface set up at our "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a>. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier! Well done!  See the "https://www.facebook.com/zoneinterditem6/videos/vb.112189452160359/955692764476686/?type=2&amp;theater" >MakingOf</a> or the "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BmGiaPG9cnA" >Report</a>;  Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti
 S. Allassonnière
 O. Colliot and S. Durrleman - "https://hal-polytechnique.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01163213/document" > A Mixed­ Effect Model with Time Reparametrization for Longitudinal Univariate Manifold-valued Data</em></a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Oral : P. Gori

 Hawaii
 USA <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: It is the primary international organization dedicated to using neuroimaging to discover the organization of the human brain. "http://www.humanbrainmapping.org/" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab has massively participated with 14 posters and a seminary talk of our team leader Olivier during the full-day course “Pattern Recognition for NeuroImaging”.  '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: January 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 24 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis
 prognosis and monitoring of Alzheimer’s disease</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: September 2016 (maybe combined with an internship in Spring 2016) - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr   Software developers<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/SoftwareEngineer_Inria_ICM.pdf">Development of a software product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression </a>- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 4 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: January 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr    Master Internships /  Stages de Master</em><ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/sujet_stage_Primates.pdf" >Comparaison de l’anatomie et de la fonction du cerveau de l’Homme avec d’autres espèces de primates</a>  - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible;;'

 ' Nov 13: New postdoc position opened!The ARAMIS lab recruits <strong>high-profile researchers
 data scientists and engineers</strong> with a solid background in statistical learning
 data science and/or medical imaging. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Nov 13: New position opened for a software developer!We recruit a talented software developer to develop a product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression and its validation in a clinical environment. More info here or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!<strong> </strong>  Oct 23: New PhD position opened!We are looking for highly motivated students with a strong background in statistical learning and data analysis. The PhD will be about the development of novel learning methods for the statistical exploitation of multimodal longitudinal data sets. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Sept 27: ARAMIS in the news!Aramis was broadcasted yesterday in the French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6) on Sunday prime time. The report was about the brain-computer interface set up at our "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a>. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario

 ' Jan 8: Congratulations to Pietro Gori!who successfully defended his PhD today about "Statistical models to learn the structural organisation of neural circuits from multimodal brain images
 with application to Gilles de la Tourette syndrome".  Dec 21: Congratulations to Takoua Kaaouana!who successfully defended her PhD today on the "detection and characterization of brain micro-bleeds with applications on mutli-centric clinical data".  Nov 13: New postdoc position opened!The ARAMIS lab recruits <strong>high-profile researchers
 data scientists and engineers</strong> with a solid background in statistical learning
 data science and/or medical imaging. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Nov 13: New position opened for a software developer!We recruit a talented software developer to develop a product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression and its validation in a clinical environment. More info here or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!<strong> </strong>  Oct 23: New PhD position opened!We are looking for highly motivated students with a strong background in statistical learning and data analysis. The PhD will be about the development of novel learning methods for the statistical exploitation of multimodal longitudinal data sets. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  '2016-01-11 16:57:31'

 ' Jan 8: Congratulations to Pietro Gori!who successfully defended his PhD today about "Statistical models to learn the structural organisation of neural circuits from multimodal brain images
 with application to Gilles de la Tourette syndrome".  Dec 21: Congratulations to Takoua Kaaouana!who successfully defended her PhD today on the "detection and characterization of brain micro-bleeds with applications on mutli-centric clinical data".  Dec 4: Congratulations to Stanley Durrleman!who won an ERC Starting Grant from the "https://erc.europa.eu/">European Research Council</a>.  Nov 13: New postdoc position opened!The ARAMIS lab recruits <strong>high-profile researchers
 data scientists and engineers</strong> with a solid background in statistical learning
 data science and/or medical imaging. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Nov 13: New position opened for a software developer!We recruit a talented software developer to develop a product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression and its validation in a clinical environment. More info here or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!<strong> </strong>  Oct 23: New PhD position opened!We are looking for highly motivated students with a strong background in statistical learning and data analysis. The PhD will be about the development of novel learning methods for the statistical exploitation of multimodal longitudinal data sets. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Sept 27: ARAMIS in the news!Aramis was broadcasted yesterday in the French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6) on Sunday prime time. The report was about the brain-computer interface set up at our "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a>. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier! Well done!  See the "https://www.facebook.com/zoneinterditem6/videos/vb.112189452160359/955692764476686/?type=2&amp;theater" >MakingOf</a> or the "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BmGiaPG9cnA" >Report</a>;  Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti
 S. Allassonnière
 O. Colliot and S. Durrleman - "https://hal-polytechnique.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01163213/document" > A Mixed­ Effect Model with Time Reparametrization for Longitudinal Univariate Manifold-valued Data</em></a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Oral : P. Gori

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: January 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 24 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: anne.bertrand@psl.aphp.fr  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: January 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/joboffer_anne.pdf" >Histological MR Imaging of proteinopathies at 11.7T</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 24 months  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: anne.bertrand@psl.aphp.fr  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis
 prognosis and monitoring of Alzheimer’s disease</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: September 2016 (maybe combined with an internship in Spring 2016) - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr   Software developers<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/SoftwareEngineer_Inria_ICM.pdf">Development of a software product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression </a>- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 4 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: January 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr    Master Internships /  Stages de Master</em><ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/sujet_stage_Primates.pdf" >Comparaison de l’anatomie et de la fonction du cerveau de l’Homme avec d’autres espèces de primates</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/stage_segmentation_hippoHR_finale20160119.pdf" >Segmentation automatisée des sous régions de l\'hippocampe humain en IRM in-vivo à très haut champ</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 6 months - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: marie.chupin@upmc.fr '

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience

 '2016-03-15 11:27:32'

 ' March 15: ARAMIS in the newsINRIA official website features the research of the ARAMIS Lab on the occasion of the French "Brain week". Full article "http://www.inria.fr/centre/paris/actualites/quand-les-statistiques-percent-les-mysteres-du-cerveau">here</a> (in French)
 and more pics "http://phototheque.inria.fr/phototheque/category/750">there</a>. Enjoy and Share!  Jan 8: Congratulations to Pietro Gori!who successfully defended his PhD today about "Statistical models to learn the structural organisation of neural circuits from multimodal brain images
 with application to Gilles de la Tourette syndrome".  Dec 21: Congratulations to Takoua Kaaouana!who successfully defended her PhD today on the "detection and characterization of brain micro-bleeds with applications on mutli-centric clinical data".  Dec 4: Congratulations to Stanley Durrleman!who won an ERC Starting Grant from the "https://erc.europa.eu/">European Research Council</a>.  Nov 13: New postdoc position opened!The ARAMIS lab recruits <strong>high-profile researchers
 data scientists and engineers</strong> with a solid background in statistical learning
 data science and/or medical imaging. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Nov 13: New position opened for a software developer!We recruit a talented software developer to develop a product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression and its validation in a clinical environment. More info here or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!<strong> </strong>  Oct 23: New PhD position opened!We are looking for highly motivated students with a strong background in statistical learning and data analysis. The PhD will be about the development of novel learning methods for the statistical exploitation of multimodal longitudinal data sets. More info "https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">here</a> or in the "https://www.aramislab.fr/job-offers/">job offer section</a>!  Sept 27: ARAMIS in the news!Aramis was broadcasted yesterday in the French TV newsmagazine  Zone Interdite</em> (M6) on Sunday prime time. The report was about the brain-computer interface set up at our "http://cenir.org/fr/lequipe-meg-eeg.html" >EEG/MEG Centre</a>. The journalist managed to write the word "Fascinant!" using only her brain. Congratulations Mario
 Fabrizio
 Fanny
 Laurent and Xavier! Well done!  See the "https://www.facebook.com/zoneinterditem6/videos/vb.112189452160359/955692764476686/?type=2&amp;theater" >MakingOf</a> or the "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BmGiaPG9cnA" >Report</a>;  Conference IPMI 2015 - Information Processing in Medical Imaging<span style="text-decoration: underline;">Date : 28th June - 3rd July 2015 <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Location : Sabhal Mor Ostaig College
 Isle of Skye
 Scotland <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description: One of the preeminent international forums for presentation of leading-edge research in the medical imaging field. "http://ipmi2015.cs.ucl.ac.uk" >link</a> <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Comments: The Aramis Lab participated with two works selected respectively for oral and poster presentation. The poster was then chosen by the participants for an oral presentation. Bravo Jean-Baptiste! <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Poster: J.-B. Schiratti

 ' <img class=" wp-image-61 aligncenter" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Picture_Aramis-1024x578.jpg" alt="Picture_Aramis" width="819" height="462" /> <span style="color: #000000;">Direction<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/index.html" >Olivier Colliot </a>- CNRS Research Director (DR) - "https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/index.html" >webpage</a> - olivier.colliot@upmc.fr  <ul> 	Didier Dormont - Professor of Neuroradiology (PU-PH)
 UPMC / AP-HP - didier.dormont@psl.aphp.fr   Researchers<ul> 	Mario Chavez - CNRS Researcher (CR1) - mario.chavez@upmc.fr 	Marie Chupin - CNRS Research Engineer (IR) - marie.chupin@upmc.fr 	"https://who.rocq.inria.fr/Stanley.Durrleman/index.html" >Stanley Durrleman </a>- Inria Researcher - "https://who.rocq.inria.fr/Stanley.Durrleman/index.html" >webpage</a> - stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	Fabrizio De Vico Fallani - Inria Researcher (HDR) - "https://sites.google.com/site/fabriziodevicofallani/" >webpage</a> - fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com   Medical Faculty / Clinicians<ul> 	Claude Adam - Neurologist (PH)

 ' <img class=" wp-image-61 aligncenter" src="https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Picture_Aramis-1024x578.jpg" alt="Picture_Aramis" width="819" height="462" /> <span style="color: #000000;">Direction<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/index.html" >Olivier Colliot </a>- CNRS Research Director (DR) - "https://www.aramislab.fr/perso/colliot/index.html" >webpage</a> - olivier.colliot@upmc.fr  <ul> 	Didier Dormont - Professor of Neuroradiology (PU-PH)
 UPMC / AP-HP - didier.dormont@psl.aphp.fr   Researchers<ul> 	Mario Chavez - CNRS Researcher (CR1) - mario.chavez@upmc.fr 	Marie Chupin - CNRS Research Engineer (IR) - marie.chupin@upmc.fr 	"https://who.rocq.inria.fr/Stanley.Durrleman/index.html" >Stanley Durrleman </a>- Inria Researcher - "https://who.rocq.inria.fr/Stanley.Durrleman/index.html" >webpage</a> - stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	Fabrizio De Vico Fallani - Inria Researcher (HDR) - "https://sites.google.com/site/fabriziodevicofallani/" >webpage</a> - fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com   Medical Faculty / Clinicians<ul> 	Claude Adam - Neurologist (PH)
 AP-HP - claude.adam@psl.aphp.fr 	Anne Bertrand - Neuroradiologist (PH)
 AP-HP - anne.bertrand@psl.aphp.fr 	Sophie Dupont - Professor of Neurology (PU-PH)
 UPMC / AP-HP - sophie.dupont@psl.aphp.fr 	Damien Galanaud - Professor of Neuroradiology (PU-PH)
 UPMC / AP-HP - damien.galanaud@icm-institute.org 	Dominique Hasboun - Associate Professor of Neuroanatomy (MCU)

 '2016-05-23 17:49:03'
 '2016-05-23 16:49:03'
 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience

 '2016-12-06 12:23:11'
 '2016-12-06 11:23:11'
 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  anytime - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/postdoc_HIPLAY7.pdf">Medical image computing for high-resolution 7 Tesla MRI</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Research_position_NETBCI.pdf" >Dynamic brain networks in brain-computer interface learning</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: 1 April 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com</del>  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis
 prognosis and monitoring of Alzheimer’s disease</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: September 2016 (maybe combined with an internship in Spring 2016) - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.f</del>r   Engineers / Software developers<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/software_developer-2.pdf">Software Development Engineer</a>- Modeling progression of brain diseases from neuroimaging data - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/software_developper.pdf">Software Developer</a> - Development of software for analysis of multimodal medical imaging data - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible</del> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/data_manager_image_analyst.pdf">Data Manager / Image Analyst</a> - Modeling progression of Alzheimer’s disease from brain imaging data - Starting date: as soon as possible</del> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/SoftwareEngineer_Inria_ICM.pdf">Development of a software product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression </a>- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 4 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr</del>    Master Internships /  Stages de Master</em><ul> 	See PhD thesis above '

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  anytime - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/postdoc_HIPLAY7.pdf">Medical image computing for high-resolution 7 Tesla MRI</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr 	Knowledge models for analysis and interpretation of genetic data - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 18 months - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  November 2017 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Research_position_NETBCI.pdf" >Dynamic brain networks in brain-computer interface learning</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: 1 April 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com</del>  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis
 prognosis and monitoring of Alzheimer’s disease</a>  -  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: September 2016 (maybe combined with an internship in Spring 2016) - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.f</del>r   Engineers / Software developers<ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/software_developer-2.pdf">Software Development Engineer</a>- Modeling progression of brain diseases from neuroimaging data - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/software_developper.pdf">Software Developer</a> - Development of software for analysis of multimodal medical imaging data - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible</del> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/data_manager_image_analyst.pdf">Data Manager / Image Analyst</a> - Modeling progression of Alzheimer’s disease from brain imaging data - Starting date: as soon as possible</del> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/SoftwareEngineer_Inria_ICM.pdf">Development of a software product for the construction of virtual models of brain disease progression </a>- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 4 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr</del>    Master Internships /  Stages de Master</em><ul> 	See PhD thesis above '

 '<strong>If you are interested in joining the team (with respect to any of our research topics)
 do not hesitate to send us an e-mail stating your field of interest and a CV. We may have other open positions than those advertised below. </strong>You can directly contact one of the "https://www.aramislab.fr/?page_id=4" >permanent researchers</a> of the team
 or the "mailto:olivier.colliot@upmc.fr">head</a> of the team for a general inquiry. Our team is pluridisciplinary and we welcome applicants with different profiles and expertises (computer science
 electrical engineering
 neuroimaging
 neuroscience
 medicine...). <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">Postdocs / Scientists </h1> <ul> 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/JobOffer_ARAMIS.pdf">Statistical Learning in Medical Imaging</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 5 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  anytime - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: stanley.durrleman@inria.fr 	"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/postdoc_HIPLAY7.pdf">Medical image computing for high-resolution 7 Tesla MRI</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  as soon as possible - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr 	"http://URL https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Post-doc-2017_IPL_Neuromarkers_For_diffusion-2.pdf">Knowledge models for analysis and interpretation of genetic data</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: 18 months - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date:  November 2017 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: olivier.colliot@upmc.fr 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Research_position_NETBCI.pdf" >Dynamic brain networks in brain-computer interface learning</a> - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Duration: from 2 to 3 years - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Starting date: 1 April 2016 - <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Contact: fabrizio.devicofallani@gmail.com</del>  <h1><span style="font-size: 20px;">PhD thesis </h1> <ul> 	<del>"https://www.aramislab.fr/files/job_offers/PhD_Inria_ICM.pdf">Learning methods for the spatiotemporal analysis of longitudinal data - Applications to the diagnosis

 electrical engineering

 (919
 1
 '2017-02-27 20:58:13'
 '2017-02-27 19:58:13'
 ' <strong>Context and general aim</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">Multiple characteristics of brain diseases can now be measured in living patients thanks to the tremendous progress of neuroimaging
 genomic and biomarker technologies. Collection of multimodal data in large patient databases provide a comprehensive view of brain alterations
 biological processes
 genetic risk factors and symptoms. <strong>The general aim of the team is to build numerical models of brain diseases from multimodal patient data</strong> based on the development of specific data-driven approaches. To this end
 we will develop new data representations and statistical learning approaches that can integrate multiple types of data acquired in the living patient including neuroimaging
 peripheral biomarkers
 clinical and omics data (genetics
 transcriptomics...). In particular
 we will develop methods to highlight networks of interactions among multiple sources of data
 to track data changes during disease progression
 and to automatically predict current or future clinical outcomes from these data. We apply these models to neurodegenerative disease (Alzheimer\'s disease and other dementia
 Multiple Sclerosis
 Parkinson\'s disease...). They shall allow to deepen our understanding of neurological diseases and to develop new decision support systems for diagnosis
 prognosis and design of clinical trials.</p> <p style="text-align: justify;"></p> <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Modeling brain structure from anatomical and diffusion MRI</strong> <p style="text-align: justify;">Computational anatomy aims at building statistical models of the structure of the human brain. This endeavor requires addressing the following methodological issues: i) the extraction of geometrical objects (anatomical structures
 lesions
 white matter tracks...) from anatomical and diffusion-weighted MRI; ii) the design of a coherent mathematical framework to model anatomical shapes and compare them across individuals. These approaches can then be used to perform statistical studies allowing to characterize the anatomical alterations associated to a given neurological disorder
 to study their progression and their correlation with symptoms and cognitive deficits.</p> <p style="text-align: justify;">Within this area
 our main research topics are :</p>  <ul> 	automatic methods to segment anatomical structures and lesions 	statistical shape models based on diffeomorphic deformations 	longitudinal models to study the progression of brain alterations over time 	7T MRI to study the internal structure of the hippocampus;  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Modeling dynamical brain networks</strong>  Functional imaging techniques (EEG
 MEG and fMRI) allow characterizing the interactions between the activities of different brain areas
 leading to understand how cognitive processes and pathological brain states emerge from an interplay of structure and function. Our research aims to provide a coherent theoretical framework for analyzing and modeling brain dynamics in terms of time-varying functional connectivity networks. Such approaches are applied to further our understanding of abnormal connectivity during some dynamical brain diseases (e.g. Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s disease) or during natural recovery from brain damage (e.g. Stroke recovery).  Within this area
 our main research topics are: <ul> 	complex networks theory to characterize connectivity patterns 	causality analysis 	analysis of time-varying networks 	brain computer interfaces for clinical applications;  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Integrating multimodal data (neuroimaging
 genomics
 clinical data)</strong>  Large-scale multimodal datasets
 combining neuroimaging
 clinical data and different types of "omics" data (genetics
 transcriptomics...) are becoming a pivotal tool for neuroscience research. These datasets are complex
 high-dimensional and often heterogeneous
 and thus require the development of new methodologies to be fully exploited. Our team aims at developing new statistical approaches to discover relevant patterns from such datasets and to integrate multimodal data from imaging and genomics. We also have a strong practical expertise in managing and analyzing massive multicenter datasets.  Within this area
 our main research topics are: <ul> 	machine learning approaches to extract biomarkers 	multimodal analysis approaches for bridging imaging and genomics 	methodologies for multicenter neuroimaging datasets (see CATI project below);  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">CATI project: managing multicenter neuroimaging studies</strong> <p style="text-align: justify;">Our team is strongly involved in the "http://cati-neuroimaging.com/">CATI project</a> (PI: J-F Mangin). CATI is a joint project with "http://www-dsv.cea.fr/en/institutes/institute-of-biomedical-imaging-i2bm/departments/neurospin-neurospin">Neurospin</a>
 "http://www.imed.jussieu.fr/">LIF</a>
 "http://www.cenir.org/">CENIR</a> and "http://fondation-recherche-alzheimer.com/375/linstitut-de-la-memoire-et-de-la-maladie-dalzheimer-im2a/">IM2A</a>
 funded by the "http://www.plan-alzheimer.gouv.fr/-44-measures-.html">Alzheimer Plan</a> which aims at building a national platform for multicenter studies. CATI aims at mutualizing all the resources required to perform multi-center neuroimaging studies. CATI services cover harmonization of image acquisition
 quality control
 monitoring
 databasing as well as data analysis. CATI is already in charge of the imaging core of more than fifteen large French multicenter studies in various disorders
 including several therapeutic trials and the national cohort of the French Alzheimer plan (2300 subjects).</p> <p style="text-align: justify;">Within CATI
 our team is particularly involved in:</p>  <ul> 	standardization of MRI acquisitions 	quality control of MRI scans 	processing of anatomical MRI data 	development of software for structural MRI analysis 	research on new image analysis approaches (segmentation
 morphometry
 machine learning);  <span style="color: #008c9e; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\'
 arial
 sans-serif; font-size: 23px; line-height: normal;">Collaborations  <strong>External collaborations</strong> Methodological collaborations  <ul> 	"http://www.ens-cachan.fr/" >ENS de Cachan</a> ("http://atrouve.perso.math.cnrs.fr/" >Alain Trouvé</a>) 	"http://www.parisdescartes.fr/" >Université Paris-Descartes</a> ("http://www.mi.parisdescartes.fr/~glaunes/" >Joan Glaunès</a>) 	Center for Applied Medical Research
 Pampelune
 Spain (M. Valencia) 	Departement of Physics. "http://ph.qmul.ac.uk/" >Queen Mary</a> "http://ph.qmul.ac.uk/" >University of London</a>

 Christel Depienne) 	ICM "http://conam.synology.me/marie/Home.html" >Marie Vidailhet / Stéphane Lehéricy\'s team</a> (Marie Vidailhet
 Stéphane Lehéricy
 Andreas Hartmann
 Yulia Worbe) 	ICM "http://research.icm-institute.org/team/57/homepage" >Richard Miles\'s team</a> 	ICM "http://research.icm-institute.org/team/58/homepage" >Stéphane Charpier\'s team</a> 	Department of Neuroradiology
 "http://pitiesalpetriere.aphp.fr/" >Pitié-Salpêtrière Hospital</a> '

 'https://www.aramislab.fr/22-revision-v1/'

 (920
 1
 '2017-02-27 20:59:11'
 '2017-02-27 19:59:11'
 ' <strong>Context and general aim</strong><p style="text-align: justify;">Multiple characteristics of brain diseases can now be measured in living patients thanks to the tremendous progress of neuroimaging
 genomic and biomarker technologies. Collection of multimodal data in large patient databases provide a comprehensive view of brain alterations
 biological processes
 genetic risk factors and symptoms.</p> <p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>The general aim of the team is to build numerical models of brain diseases from multimodal patient data</strong> based on the development of specific data-driven approaches. To this end
 we will develop new data representations and statistical learning approaches that can integrate multiple types of data acquired in the living patient including neuroimaging
 peripheral biomarkers
 clinical and omics data (genetics
 transcriptomics...). In particular
 we will develop methods to highlight networks of interactions among multiple sources of data
 to track data changes during disease progression
 and to automatically predict current or future clinical outcomes from these data. We apply these models to neurodegenerative disease (Alzheimer\'s disease and other dementia
 Multiple Sclerosis
 Parkinson\'s disease...). They shall allow to deepen our understanding of neurological diseases and to develop new decision support systems for diagnosis
 prognosis and design of clinical trials.</p> <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Modeling brain structure from anatomical and diffusion MRI</strong> <p style="text-align: justify;">Computational anatomy aims at building statistical models of the structure of the human brain. This endeavor requires addressing the following methodological issues: i) the extraction of geometrical objects (anatomical structures
 lesions
 white matter tracks...) from anatomical and diffusion-weighted MRI; ii) the design of a coherent mathematical framework to model anatomical shapes and compare them across individuals. These approaches can then be used to perform statistical studies allowing to characterize the anatomical alterations associated to a given neurological disorder
 to study their progression and their correlation with symptoms and cognitive deficits.</p> <p style="text-align: justify;">Within this area
 our main research topics are :</p>  <ul> 	automatic methods to segment anatomical structures and lesions 	statistical shape models based on diffeomorphic deformations 	longitudinal models to study the progression of brain alterations over time 	7T MRI to study the internal structure of the hippocampus;  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Modeling dynamical brain networks</strong>  Functional imaging techniques (EEG
 MEG and fMRI) allow characterizing the interactions between the activities of different brain areas
 leading to understand how cognitive processes and pathological brain states emerge from an interplay of structure and function. Our research aims to provide a coherent theoretical framework for analyzing and modeling brain dynamics in terms of time-varying functional connectivity networks. Such approaches are applied to further our understanding of abnormal connectivity during some dynamical brain diseases (e.g. Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s disease) or during natural recovery from brain damage (e.g. Stroke recovery).  Within this area
 our main research topics are: <ul> 	complex networks theory to characterize connectivity patterns 	causality analysis 	analysis of time-varying networks 	brain computer interfaces for clinical applications;  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">Integrating multimodal data (neuroimaging
 genomics
 clinical data)</strong>  Large-scale multimodal datasets
 combining neuroimaging
 clinical data and different types of "omics" data (genetics
 transcriptomics...) are becoming a pivotal tool for neuroscience research. These datasets are complex
 high-dimensional and often heterogeneous
 and thus require the development of new methodologies to be fully exploited. Our team aims at developing new statistical approaches to discover relevant patterns from such datasets and to integrate multimodal data from imaging and genomics. We also have a strong practical expertise in managing and analyzing massive multicenter datasets.  Within this area
 our main research topics are: <ul> 	machine learning approaches to extract biomarkers 	multimodal analysis approaches for bridging imaging and genomics 	methodologies for multicenter neuroimaging datasets (see CATI project below);  <strong><span style="color: #333333; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\',arial,sans-serif; font-size: 20px; line-height: normal;">CATI project: managing multicenter neuroimaging studies</strong> <p style="text-align: justify;">Our team is strongly involved in the "http://cati-neuroimaging.com/">CATI project</a> (PI: J-F Mangin). CATI is a joint project with "http://www-dsv.cea.fr/en/institutes/institute-of-biomedical-imaging-i2bm/departments/neurospin-neurospin">Neurospin</a>
 "http://www.imed.jussieu.fr/">LIF</a>
 "http://www.cenir.org/">CENIR</a> and "http://fondation-recherche-alzheimer.com/375/linstitut-de-la-memoire-et-de-la-maladie-dalzheimer-im2a/">IM2A</a>
 funded by the "http://www.plan-alzheimer.gouv.fr/-44-measures-.html">Alzheimer Plan</a> which aims at building a national platform for multicenter studies. CATI aims at mutualizing all the resources required to perform multi-center neuroimaging studies. CATI services cover harmonization of image acquisition
 quality control
 monitoring
 databasing as well as data analysis. CATI is already in charge of the imaging core of more than fifteen large French multicenter studies in various disorders
 including several therapeutic trials and the national cohort of the French Alzheimer plan (2300 subjects).</p> <p style="text-align: justify;">Within CATI
 our team is particularly involved in:</p>  <ul> 	standardization of MRI acquisitions 	quality control of MRI scans 	processing of anatomical MRI data 	development of software for structural MRI analysis 	research on new image analysis approaches (segmentation
 morphometry
 machine learning);  <span style="color: #008c9e; font-family: \'Pontano Sans\'
 arial
 sans-serif; font-size: 23px; line-height: normal;">Collaborations  <strong>External collaborations</strong> Methodological collaborations  <ul> 	"http://www.ens-cachan.fr/" >ENS de Cachan</a> ("http://atrouve.perso.math.cnrs.fr/" >Alain Trouvé</a>) 	"http://www.parisdescartes.fr/" >Université Paris-Descartes</a> ("http://www.mi.parisdescartes.fr/~glaunes/" >Joan Glaunès</a>) 	Center for Applied Medical Research
 Pampelune
 Spain (M. Valencia) 	Departement of Physics. "http://ph.qmul.ac.uk/" >Queen Mary</a> "http://ph.qmul.ac.uk/" >University of London</a>
 UK ("http://www.maths.qmul.ac.uk/~latora/" >Vito Latora</a>) 	Inria "https://team.inria.fr/asclepios/" >Asclepios</a> ("http://www-sop.inria.fr/members/Nicholas.Ayache/ayache.html" >Nicholas Ayache</a>) 	CEA "http://www-dsv.cea.fr/dsv/instituts/institut-d-imagerie-biomedicale-i2bm/services/neurospin-neurospin" >Neurospin</a> ("http://www.lnao.fr/spip.php?rubrique7" >Jean-François Mangin</a>

 "http://www-dsv.cea.fr/dsv/instituts/institut-d-imagerie-biomedicale-i2bm/services/neurospin-neurospin/recherche/unites-de-recherche/unite-de-recherche-en-neuroimagerie-applicative-clinique-et-translationnelle-uniact" >Lucie Hertz-Pannier</a>
 "http://www.incf.org/community/people/jbpoline/person_view" >Jean-Baptiste Poline</a>) 	"https://www.cmrr.umn.edu/" >Center for Magnetic Resonance Research</a>
 University of Minnesota
 USA ("http://www.cmrr.umn.edu/facultystaff/pfvdm.shtml" >Pierre-François Van de Moortele</a>

 "http://www.neurosci.umn.edu/faculty/ugurbil.html" >Kamil Ugurbil</a>) 	Scientific Computing and Imaging ("http://www.sci.utah.edu/" >SCI</a>) Institute
 University of Utah
 USA ("http://www.sci.utah.edu/~gerig/" >Guido Gerig</a>
 "https://www.bioen.utah.edu/directory/profile.php?userID=252" >Sarang Joshi</a>
 "http://www.sci.utah.edu/~prastawa/" >Marcel Prastawa</a>) 	Inria "https://www.irisa.fr/visages/" >Visages</a> ("http://www.irisa.fr/prive/barillot/" >Christian Barillot</a>) 	"http://www.anthropobiologie.fr/index.php?clear=1" >Laboratoire AMIS</a>
